definition[1]: details of the type of people that make up a particular group, in particular their age, sex, and income. This term is used especially in marketing to talk about the groups of people who buy a particular product
example[1]: When we look at the demographics of book buyers and project forward the changes in these groups, there is room for growth.
definition[2]: the study of human populations and the way in which they change, used especially in marketing when thinking about which people might buy a particular product
example[2]: Consumer targeting has been made increasingly effective by developments in demographics and statistics.
